messages.subject: Unschooling and work
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/12/02 9:44:13 AM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/12/02 9:44:13 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< There are actually lots of working parents here. >>

Yes. I'm another one of them. My dh and I run a home business that is our
main income, and I work part time out of the home.

Ren
"Knowledge will not always take the place of simple observation."
~Arnold Lobel
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com

messages.subject: Unschooling and work
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/12/02 9:44:13 AM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/12/02 9:44:13 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< No, I am not suggesting that all parents must do one thing or another,
especially that there is no choice but to have a child in school if they
work. >>

There are always other options. What do you do with your child in the summer
when he's out of school? One may have to be very creative to make it work,
but there are always options.
If you think school is a good place for your child to be, you won't fit in
here well at all.
If you're interested in changing how you think, getting ideas on how to make
it work and how to get school out of your lives, this will be a great list
for you.

Ren
"Knowledge will not always take the place of simple observation."
~Arnold Lobel
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
